com.blogspot.technicalmiracle

Class AnimationDATA

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.arch.lifecycle.ViewModel
      • com.blogspot.technicalmiracle.AnimationDATA

  • class AnimationDATA
extends android.arch.lifecycle.ViewModel
    The Animation Data class hold all necessary data of the application. The initial values will be created during the start. And after the start variable data of every fragment will be saved into the animation data class for future use. This class uses the ViewModel for simple and clear load/save operations. Data synchronization provide to support the application's LifeCycle additionally.

      • setNavigationBarHeight

        void setNavigationBarHeight(@Nullable
                            android.content.Context context,
                            @Nullable
                            android.view.WindowManager windowManager)
        Parameters:
        context - apps context
        windowManager - this device window manager When a soft navigation bar the value will set equal it's height. When an ordinary navigation set when have only buttons the value will set to zero. See : http://stackoverflow.com/questions/28983621/ for more information.

      • setLayoutDimensions

        boolean setLayoutDimensions(@Nullable
                            android.content.Context context,
                            boolean takeAccountOfaNavigationBar)
        Layout dimensions setup.
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        takeAccountOfaNavigationBar - Do cut the NavigationBar on LandScape Mode?
        Returns:
        'true' if values did set When this device has a soft NavigationBar this NavigationBar will be disabled on the Arbitrary Animation screen with the Landscape mode a layout width will change at this occasion.

      • setLayoutDimensions

        void setLayoutDimensions(float width,
                         float height)
        Layout dimensions setup.
        Parameters:
        width - A layout width
        height - A layout height
